items.title: Het Ajax-sprookje van Grim: â€˜Cruijff zag het best wel in mij zittenâ€™
items.summary: Voetbal International viert dit jaar zijn zestigjarig jubileum. Naar aanleiding daarvan herplaatsen we elke dag in het weekeinde een verhaal uit ons rijke archief. Deze keer gaan we terug naar augustus 1999, als VIâ€™s Frans van den Nieuwenhof uitgebreid aan tafel gaat zitten met Fred Grim. De doelman zit dan al vijf jaar bij Ajax, heeft met de Amsterdammers alles gewonnen wat er te winnen valt, maar wÃ©l steeds als reserve. Door het vertrek van Edwin van der Sar naar Juventus is hij eindelijk de nummer 1 onder de lat. Een boeiend gesprek met de toekomstige (interim-)trainer van Ajax.

items.title: The Ashes LIVE! England reach 150-3 chasing record 435 to save Ashes
USMNT's Adams (torn MCL) out up to 3 months
items.summary: United States international Tyler Adams will be out for up to three months after tearing a medial collateral ligament, Bournemouth coach Andoni Iraola said Friday.

items.title: Arteta on Arsenal future: I have to earn new deal
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has hinted he could stay at Arsenal beyond his current contract but suggested he would have to earn any new deal.

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.

items.title: Wrexham boss defends keeper after derby blunder
items.summary: Phil Parkinson defended "colossus" Arthur Okonkwo after the Wrexham goalkeeper's 90th-minute howler gifted Swansea a 2-1 victory in a hard-fought Welsh derby.

items.title: Milik na anderhalf jaar weer bij wedstrijdselectie Juventus
items.summary: Heuglijk nieuws voor Arkadiusz Milik: de Poolse spits zit voor het eerst in ruim anderhalf jaar weer eens bij de wedstrijdselectie van Juventus. In die periode werd Milik geteisterd door blessureproblemen.

items.title: 'That is how you put a game to bed!' | Aspinall wins with Big Fish
items.summary: An incredible 170 checkout saw Nathan Aspinall secure the hard-fought first round win over Lourence Ilagan.

items.title: Man City 'must prepare' for successor, says Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says Man City "must be prepared" to plan for his eventual departure, after Enzo Maresca says reports suggesting he could succeed the Spaniard are "100% speculation".

items.title: Maresca plays dangerous game as confusion reigns after his Chelsea grenade
items.summary: Club remain bemused by head coach creating speculation he has issues with the hierarchy who want to avoid drama at all costs One of the theories doing the rounds this week is that Enzo Maresca is behaving like someone who wants to be sacked. He has stumbled into a fight he cannot win. It did not go down well with Chelsea when Maresca lobbed a grenade into the mix by talking about not being supported enough after last Saturdayâ€™s humdrum win against Everton and it is hard not to read his refusal to defuse the situation since then as the stance of a man daring his bosses to act. Chelsea remain bemused by their head coach creating speculation that he has issues with the clubâ€™s hierarchy by saying that the 48 hours before the Everton game had been his worst since joining the club. Sources say the outburst even caught people close to Maresca by surprise. Confusion reigns. It does not help that Maresca has publicly and privately rejected repeated opportunities to explain the source of his discontent, leaving it open for outsiders to assume that the Italianâ€™s issues are with Chelseaâ€™s hierarchy. Continue reading...

items.title: Thomas Frank talks sense but Tottenhamâ€™s lack of style has supporters worried
items.summary: Dane wants time but before Saturdayâ€™s match against Liverpool, faithful are frustrated by stodgy performances There are plenty of well-known checkpoints in the life cycle of a Tottenham manager and we have reached one with Thomas Frank. It is the pleading for time bit. â€œIf nobody gets this, nobody will be able to turn this around,â€ he said after last Sundayâ€™s 3-0 Premier League defeat at Nottingham Forest. It is not a â€œquick fix,â€ he added. And nobody was about to disagree. Frank is veering towards another â€“ the one where it is as if he wants to scream, to release the inner hurricane that he referenced in Nottingham. Is anybody seeing what he is seeing? In other words, the immense difficulties that he faces. Continue reading...

items.title: Mikel Arteta admits long-term future at Arsenal dependent on winning silverware
items.summary: Spaniard approaches sixth anniversary in charge Arteta â€˜has to earn the right to be here tomorrowâ€™ Mikel Arteta has conceded his long-term future at Arsenal is dependent on winning silverware as he prepares to celebrate his sixth anniversary in charge. The Spaniard was appointed on 20 December 2019 and led Arsenal to the FA Cup a few months later but that remains his only major trophy since replacing Unai Emery. Arteta will mark six years in the job against his former club Everton on Saturday night â€“ the same opponents Arsenal faced a day after he was announced as their manager. He watched that game from the stands before officially beginning his role the next day. Continue reading...

items.title: FIFA straft Al Nassr met transferban
items.summary: Een flinke tegenvaller voor Al Nassr: de FIFA heeft de Saoedische club gestraft met een transferban. De club van Cristiano Ronaldo mag per direct geen nieuwe spelers meer inschrijven.

items.title: Alfred Schreuder begint weer na hartproblemen: 'Bewust even gestopt'
items.summary: Alfred Schreuder is sinds kort weer trainer. De 53-jarige oefenmeester ging aan de slag bij Al-Diriyah uit Saoedi-ArabiÃ«. In de maanden daarvoor koos Schreuder er bewust voor om het even rustig aan te doen. Hij vertelt openhartig over de fysieke problemen die hij heeft gehad.

items.title: Under-fire Wolves chief Shi steps down
items.summary: Wolves' under-fire executive chairman Jeff Shi steps down, after a desperate start to the season for the club who sit bottom of the Premier League.

items.title: 'It's not a tiger!' | Ilagan TERRIFIED by Ally Pally wasp
items.summary: Relive the hilarious moment Lourence Ilagan was left frightened by the infamous Ally Pally wasp!

items.title: Cambuur als eerste KKD-ploeg een heel jaar ongeslagen in eigen huis
items.summary: Cambuur kroonde zich vrijdagavond tot de eerste ploeg ooit die een heel kalenderjaar geen wedstrijd verloor in de Eerste Divisie. De ploeg uit Leeuwarden won overtuigend van MVV waarmee het totaal van 2025 op zeventien overwinningen en drie remises eindigt.

items.title: Greaves loses Gurney epic as Aspinall makes winning start to Worlds
items.summary: Beau Greaves narrowly missed out on becoming the second woman in history to win a match at the World Darts Championship after a dramatic 3-2 defeat to Daryl Gurney at Alexandra Palace.
